intro: Blepharocalyx suaveolens var. umbilicatus, commonly known as the sweet-scented palaquio, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its fragrant, white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has palmately lobed leaves and produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
